top_categories.workout_context: 85ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At 66° South Pyrénées, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
66° South Pyrénées' Pyrénées mountains, Mountain gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 65 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic 66° South Pyrénées' demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of 66° South Pyrénées. Train it until it feels boring.
5,500ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
5,500ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
65 miles on pyrénées mountain gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Low-cadence force work for 5,500ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At 66° South Pyrénées, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on pyrénées mountain gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for 66° South Pyrénées’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at 66° South Pyrénées. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at 66° South Pyrénées requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on pyrénées mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: pyrénées mountains, mountain gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 65 miles of pyrénées mountain gravel in Pyrénées, France.
